attic-abstract.title: Flower of the Attic
attic-abstract.about: This piece was created by the original owner of 3 Blueberry Court, Kristen Holt Donovan. It was left behind in the attic, perhaps intentionally, possibly forgotten.

bank-sheet.title: Break in case of Emergency
bank-sheet.about: This is an uncut sheet of 16 $2 bills. They are pof series 1976. This was given to Matthew by his Uncle James, who was a bank VP at the time.

carbink.title: Carbink
carbink.about: This is a pencil drawing of the Pokemon Carbink. While watching 'Pokémon the Movie: Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction', we learned that there a Carbink named Merrick. This fact then inspired the drawing and became one of our favorites.

dash-the-dog.title: Dash
dash-the-dog.about: This is a drawing of our dog Dash that Merrick drew at home with Nancy.

explication.title: The English Government
explication.about: Painting occupied only a fraction of David's time during the Revolution. He also made designs for civic uniforms, for money and official seals and even produced two crudely drawn and vulgar caricatures that mocked the English. Since the Revolution his views on the English had clearly changed and he no longer felt them to be the epitome of a free nation. According to the print's caption the English government 'is personified by the figure of a Devil skinned alive, monopolizing commerce and covered with all the Royal decorations. The portrait of the king is located at the rear end of the government which vomits on its people a myriad of taxes which overwhelm them.'

fall.title: Fall: Leaf
fall.about: An image of a leaf to represent the fall season in the "Seasons" series. Merrick used the technique of applying paint to a taped canvas to achieve the shape.

farm-house.title: 1615 Bull
farm-house.about: This is an areal photograph of Nancy's parents farm house where she grew up in Ohio. The back reads "Bought 1879 by Ezra and Mary (Bowman) Wampler; then Joseph Wampler; Then Earl and Phoebe (Allen) Wampler - 1960" The house is on the bottom, blocked by trees. Clockwise from the house is goes, water house, tool shed, barn, tobacco shed and the garage. Above the barn is a scale house and a corn shed. Crops are planted in the top corner while the bottom corner consists of the sheep field.

fruit-still-life.title: Still Life with Fruit and Oysters
fruit-still-life.about: This carefully laid table likely never existed in reality. However, the food items depicted did form part of the meals enjoyed by the wealthy. They washed down fresh fruit and oysters with a glass of fine wine. Despite appearing local, many of the products and raw materials were imported from neighbouring countries. For instance, bread was baked locally, but the used grain came from countries bordering the Baltic Sea.

life-is-a-ball.title: Life is a Ball
life-is-a-ball.about: In 1994, Stephen suffered from Adult Respiratory Distress Syndrome after falling down a flight of stairs, and it left him in a coma for two months. Just before the accident, Stephen had been inspired to do a series of woodcut prints based on his dog Sally. After waking up from the coma, Stephen immediately began work on those woodcuts. The first woodcut he carved was "Life Is A Ball", celebrating his new-found life. It remains one of the most cherished and iconic of Stephen's works.

matt.title: Caricature of Matthew
matt.about: This piece was created by the original owner of 3 Blueberry Court, Kristen Holt Donovan. It was left behind in the attic, perhaps intentionally, possibly forgotten.

meadow.title: Entrée de bois
meadow.about: Translation: Forest Entrance. Jacob Isaacksz van Ruisdael is the most prominent and innovative representative of the landscape genre in the Dutch school during the second half of the 17th century. Since the beginning of the century a number of masters in Holland had shown an interest in capturing the different nuances of light and in depicting cloudy skies, granting nature a poetic quality and taking the genre to new heights. Ruisdael began to paint at a very early age with his father and his uncle, who were also well known for their landscapes. In 1649 he was accepted as a master in the guild of painters of Haarlem, and in 1657 he moved to Amsterdam, where he remained for the rest of his life.

merrick.title: Caricature of Merrick
merrick.about: This caricature was created at an event at the Launch trampoline park. Merrick did well sitting for this while he was quickly drawn up in style.

northern-lights-m.title: Norther Lights - Left
northern-lights-m.about: This is a painting of the northern lights on the outskirts of a forest with the start of a mountain and more trees in the distance. Matthew painted this piece at the Muse Paint Bar in Somerville, while Nancy painted its pair. They went there in celebration of their anniversary. They chose a norther lights theme also in celebration of their trip to Norway in which they saw the norther lights in person.

northern-lights-n.title: Norther Lights - Right
northern-lights-n.about: This is a painting of the northern lights dancing over a dense pine forest with a comet trailing through. Nancy painted this piece at the Muse Paint Bar in Somerville, while Matthew painted its pair. They went there in celebration of their anniversary. They chose a norther lights theme also in celebration of their trip to Norway in which they saw the norther lights in person.

pickle-bandit.title: Pickle Sheriff
pickle-bandit.about: Wonder Thunder is a textile and home goods shop dreamed up by Meagan Claire Hall and has been bringing you angry toast and smiling ice cream since 2005. Wonder Thunder has drawn and screen-printed all the way from the Appalachian Center for Craft in Smithville, Tennessee, to Portland, Oregon and Seattle, Washington, where this particular piece originated. #45

planets.title: Two Bodies
planets.about: Dave painted these two planets using some bowls and spray paint. He did so for his housewarming party in which guests were asked to bring and hang a piece of art. As a parting give a series of celestial bodies were created and available to take home.

sailboat.title: TODO
sailboat.about: This painting was done by Matthew's grandfather. It was done while he was recovering from surgery.

spring.title: Spring: Flower
spring.about: April showers bring May flowers and that is what Merrick painted here for spring. Merrick did the painting while Matthew did the taping. This piece rounded out the "Seasons" series.

stormtrooper.title: Clone Trooper - AT-TE Gunner
stormtrooper.about: TODO appears to be a DC-15 series blaster rifle.

summer.title: Summer: Sun
summer.about: Merrick painted the summer sun here, the second of his "Seasons" series. Matthew added some tape while Merrick selected the colors and painted the canvas.

three-trees.title: The Three Trees
three-trees.about: The Three Trees is Rembrandt's largest and most striking etched landscape. Here he masterfully combined techniques (drypoint, engraving, varied depths of etched lines, and a speckled tone) to create a sense of nature in flux. He animated the landscape with many details: an artist sketching on the hill at right, a fisher couple at lower left, and an amorous couple hidden in the darkened foreground bushes. Some of the unnatural cloud formations left of center indicate that Rembrandt may have etched The Three Trees on a plate that contained an abandoned sketch for The Death of the Virgin, a composition he continued on a larger plate in 1639.

winter.title: Winter: Snowman
winter.about: The first in Merrick's "Seasons" series. A depiction of a snowman to capture the winter season. Matthew added some tape and Merrick did the rest.
